meanings.definition: The state or quality of lacking courage or determination.
meanings.sent1: Her spinelessnesses showed when she refused to stand up for herself.
meanings.sent2: His spinelessnesses made it difficult for him to make important decisions.
meanings.sent3: Despite his spinelessnesses, he managed to muster the courage to speak up in the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The spinelessnesses of the team leader caused the project to fail.
meanings.sent5: The spinelessnesses of the character in the story served as a cautionary tale.

meanings.definition: The act of being weak or easily influenced.
meanings.sent1: Peer pressure can lead to spinelessnesses in some individuals.
meanings.sent2: She fell into spinelessnesses when faced with difficult choices.
meanings.sent3: His spinelessnesses in the face of temptation surprised his friends.
meanings.sent4: The spinelessnesses of the group led to poor decision-making.
meanings.sent5: The spinelessnesses of the child were evident in how easily they gave in to demands.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being cowardly or lacking backbone.
meanings.sent1: His spinelessnesses in confronting bullies made him a target.
meanings.sent2: The politician's spinelessnesses were evident in his constant flip-flopping.
meanings.sent3: The spinelessnesses of the kitten made everyone laugh as it ran from a tiny mouse.
meanings.sent4: She despised the spinelessnesses of those who refused to take a stand.
meanings.sent5: The spinelessnesses of the villain made them a less intimidating character.
